title.narrative: Gender and Households in Area C

description.narrative: The project is a one year research to be conducted by the Institute of Women's Studies at the Birzeit University in Ramallah. The focus of this research is finding out the impact of the developments in Area C such as movement and access restrictions, settler violence and forced displacements and demolitions on intra-household gender roles and relations. The research will address a serious gapin existing knowledge and literature on the issue. The research is based on the assumption that the impact would be contradictory in as much as it could worsen the manifestation of patriarchy but also create openings for women and men to re-shape and re-configuretheir roles, relations and subjectivity as men and women, boys and girls. The research will result in the following outcome: Quantitative and qualitative research focussing on Area C of the West Bank reveals the gendered impact of the conflict at household level exposing clear programmatic and policy influencing gaps that national and international agenciesmust address if they want to meaningfully respond to the protection needs of the Palestinian men, women, boys and girls living in Area C. This will be achieved by producing two types of reports: - a quantitative report with data and preliminary analysisat the end of the first 6 months of this grant. - an in-depth report building upon and including the above AND qualitative analysis and recommendations for action (both programmatic and policy influencing) by the national and the international community(governmental and non-governmental).

participating-org.narrative: Founded in 1994 as an interdisciplinary Women#s Studies Program, the Institute of Women#s Studies (IWS) at Birzeit University is among the first academic centers for the study of gender founded in the Middle East. The IWS came at a critical time, when Palestinianhigher education clearly needed to develop new academic and research programs that addressed the developmental needs of Palestiniansociety. Palestinian women faced and continue to face formidable challenges in pursuing effective strategies to address basic social and development issues in order to build a society based on gender equity. The Institute undertakes teaching, research, gender-based community intervention, and influencing social policies. From its inception, the Institute sought to: contribute to the development of the study of gender at both bachelor and master levels, using an interdisciplinary approach and more broadly introduce students to ongoing debates and critiques around women issues at the local, regional and global levels, and encourages student engagementin these; and increase scientific knowledge using gender-sensitive methods, empower researchers to use feminist analysis tools and contribute to the development of Palestinian research competencies. IWS have also focused on ensuring that its research, teaching and outreach support civil society, especially the women#s movement and social movements, and public policy development through providing training and capacity building support based on quality academic research.Throughout its history the Institute has sought to build its internal academic and institutional capacities and those of the University while at the same time ensuring the relevance of its work within the broader Palestinian community, as well as contributing to academic and socio-political debates and developments in the region and the international community at large.
Institute of women's Studies Bir Zeit University
